text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Office Cherifien des Phosphates's exports totalled $1.4 billion in 1996.
- Opposition Progress and Socialism party leader Ali Yata is still in a critical condition. He was hurt in a car accident last Saturday.
- Many government officials and politicians paid get well visit to Yata.
- Stone-throwing at passing trains became increasingly alarming. The authorities listed 802 incidents in the first quarter of 1997 against 683 in the same period last year.
- Employees are to elect voter colleges beginning September 26 to September 30. The voter colleges will later elect members of the upper house, the Chamber of Counsellors.
